PIC32CX-BZ Zigbee API Reference
Data Fields
ZDO_MgmtLeaveReq_t Struct Reference

This request is generated from a local device requesting that a remote device leaves the network or that another device leaves the network. More...

#include <zdo.h>

Data Fields

uint8_t deviceAddr [8]
 Reserved; can not be changed by user.
uint8_t rejoin: 1
uint8_t removeChildren: 1
uint8_t reserved: 6

Detailed Description

This request is generated from a local device requesting that a remote device leaves the network or that another device leaves the network.

The device that receives this ZDP request sends the NLME-LEAVE.request to the device which address is specified in the payload's deviceAddr field. Besides the deviceAddr field, the structure also has two more bit fields embraced into a single octet and taking 1 or 0 as a value:

  • removeChildren - should be 1 to force the children of the affected node to leave as well, otherwise, 0
  • rejoin - if it equals 1 the destination node will attempt ro rejoin the network after it leaves

Definition at line 668 of file zdo.h.

Field Documentation

uint8_t ZDO_MgmtLeaveReq_t::deviceAddr[8]

Reserved; can not be changed by user.

The extended address of the device that should leave the network as a result network leave ZDP request. If the device specified as the destination (via the ZDO_ZdpReq_t::dstExtAddr or ZDO_ZdpReq_t::dstNwkAddr field) is to leave the network then this field may be set to 0.

Definition at line 677 of file zdo.h.

uint8_t ZDO_MgmtLeaveReq_t::rejoin

This field shall be set to 1 if the device being asked to leave the network is also asked to remove all its child devices, if any. Otherwise, it is 0.

This field shall have be set 1 if the device being asked to leave from the current parent is requested to rejoin the network after if leaves it. If this field os set to 0 the device will not rejoin the network.

Definition at line 686 of file zdo.h.
